abstract: Timothy Aubry reviews books Bibliotech: Why Libraries Matter More Than Than Ever in the Age of Google by John Palfrey, The World Between Two Covers by Ann Morgan, Where I'm Reading From: The Changing World of Books by Tim Parks, Browsings: A Year of Reading, Collecting and Living With Books by Michael Dirda, and The Nearest Thing To Life by James Wood.
lead_paragraph: New books include John Palfrey’s “Bibliotech: Why Libraries Matter More Than Ever in the Age of Google.”
snippet: New books include John Palfrey’s “Bibliotech: Why Libraries Matter More Than Ever in the Age of Google.”
